channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023081578
item.description:
Report X-2023081578

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered leaking at 11am by a operations manager. The manager placed the hazmat in a plastic bag/red tote and stored it in QA1. DescribePack: One of the caps is loose. The seal wrapped around the cap is broken. There is black sulfuric acid on the inside of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a hazmat bin/plastic bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This pkg was discovered dmgd during preload. The pkg was placed in a red tote and plastic hazmat bag and placed in a blue cart with other dmgds behind SWAK5. At 5:20pm I discovered this pkg and took it to QA1. DescribePack: Two of the jugs had loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmats were placed in plastic bags and bins.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to unload trailer 838408 and pkg was wet and it was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage. DescribePack: closures came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton. DurationRel: 31 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected

item.title: Report X-2023080892
item.description:
Report X-2023080892

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080892 SequenceEvent: Package discovered lekaing contents. Placed in tote and brought to damages. DescribePack: Found 2 bottles with broken cracked lids allowing content loss from both bottles. 2L from one and 1L from the other. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All contents contained in tote. 2. X-2023080893 SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking while in unload. Placed in tote and brought to damages for inspection. DescribePack: Found one bottle had spilled 2L due to a broken cracked lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All contents contained in tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080885
item.description:
Report X-2023080885

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in QA damages, package came from van lines punctured, wet & stained with something brown. Package was immediately bagged & placed in a Hazmat tote. Inspected items in package for loose caps or punctures. Although there was no visible damage to bottles, one of them was slightly leaking but not certain from where. DescribePack: There is a big puncture on the box. Bottom of box was ripped open possibly because of the internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was bagged & placed in a Hazmat tote to prevent any further damage.

item.title: Report E-2023080830
item.description:
Report E-2023080830

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1760 Betco Extreme release from a 5-gallon bladder box. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately all 5-gallons of product released impacting a 5' x 6' area of the trailer floor and 10' x 5' area of the concrete lot below due to a puncture. Water was utilized to neutralize the impacted area and then collected with absorbents. All impacted absorbents were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. the damaged box was containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080773
item.description:
Report X-2023080773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment was placed into a hazmat bag and hazmat spill tote then taken to the hazmat cage at 2:30am to be contained until processing. DescribePack: The metal drum is dented inward and the labeling beneath the dents are miscolored and show signs of saturation from the leaked contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat bag and hazmat spill tote negated the effects of release.

item.title: Report X-2023080756
item.description:
Report X-2023080756

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking on when loaded to the van. It was brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, contents were found having loose caps and an eroded seal allowing for contents to leak. DescribePack: Cap was loose and seal was eroded so that only the thin plastic remained on top of the hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with liner and orientation arrows were observed.

item.title: Report E-2023080842
item.description:
Report E-2023080842

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one 250 pound cylinder of nitrogen (un1977) was venting due to improper preparation for transit. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the 10 pound release.
